field.name: SBR
field.description: Baud Rate Modulo Divisor.\n The 13 bits in SBR[12:0] set the modulo divide rate for the baud rate generator. When SBR is 1 - 8191, the baud rate equals "baud clock / ((OSR+1) x SBR)". The 13-bit baud rate setting [SBR12:SBR0] must only be updated when the transmitter and receiver are both disabled (LPUART_CTRL[RE] and LPUART_CTRL[TE] are both 0)

field.name: SBNS
field.description: Stop Bit Number Select\n SBNS determines whether data characters are one or two stop bits. This bit should only be changed when the transmitter and receiver are both disabled

field.name: RXEDGIE
field.description: RX Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable\n Enables the receive input active edge, RXEDGIF, to generate interrupt requests. Changing CTRL[LOOP] or CTRL[RSRC] when RXEDGIE is set can cause the RXEDGIF to set

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupts from LPUART_STAT[RXEDGIF] disabled (use polling)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupt requested when LPUART_STAT[RXEDGIF] flag is 1

field.name: LBKDIE
field.description: LIN Break Detect Interrupt Enable\n LBKDIE enables the LIN break detect flag, LBKDIF, to generate interrupt requests

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupts from LPUART_STAT[LBKDIF] disabled (use polling)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupt requested when LPUART_STAT[LBKDIF] flag is 1

field.name: RESYNCDIS
field.description: Resynchronization Disable\n When set, disables the resynchronization of the received data word when a data one followed by data zero transition is detected. This bit should only be changed when the receiver is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Resynchronization during received data word is supported

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Resynchronization during received data word is disabled

field.name: BOTHEDGE
field.description: Both Edge Sampling\n Enables sampling of the received data on both edges of the baud rate clock, effectively doubling the number of times the receiver samples the input data for a given oversampling ratio. This bit must be set for oversampling ratios between x4 and x7 and is optional for higher oversampling ratios. This bit should only be changed when the receiver is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising edge of the baud rate clock

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising and falling edge of the baud rate clock

field.name: MATCFG
field.description: Match Configuration\n Configures the match addressing mode used

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: Enables RWU on Data Match and Match On/Off for transmitter CTS input

field.name: RDMAE
field.description: Receiver Full DMA Enable (only on device with DMA)\n RDMAE configures the receiver data register full flag, LPUART_STAT[RDRF], to generate a DMA request

field.name: TDMAE
field.description: Transmitter DMA Enable (only on device with DMA)\n TDMAE configures the transmit data register empty flag, LPUART_STAT[TDRE], to generate a DMA request

field.name: OSR
field.description: Over Sampling Ratio\n This field configures the oversampling ratio for the receiver between 4x (00011) and 32x (11111). Writing an invalid oversampling ratio will default to an oversampling ratio of 16 (01111). This field should only be changed when the transmitter and receiver are both disabled

field.name: M10
field.description: 10-bit Mode select The M10 bit causes a tenth bit to be part of the serial transmission. This bit should only be changed when the transmitter and receiver are both disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit or 9-bit data characters

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver and transmitter use 10-bit data characters

field.name: MAEN2
field.description: Match Address Mode Enable 2

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA2]

field.name: MAEN1
field.description: Match Address Mode Enable 1

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA1]

field.name: MA2F
field.description: Match 2 Flag\n MA2F is set whenever the next character to be read from LPUART_DATA matches MA2. \n To clear MA2F, write a logic one to the MA2F

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Received data is not equal to MA2

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Received data is equal to MA2

field.name: MA1F
field.description: Match 1 Flag\n MA1F is set whenever the next character to be read from LPUART_DATA matches MA1. \n To clear MA1F, write a logic one to the MA1F

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Received data is not equal to MA1

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Received data is equal to MA1

field.name: PF
field.description: Parity Error Flag\n PF is set whenever the next character to be read from LPUART_DATA was received when parity is enabled (PE = 1) and the parity bit in the received character does not agree with the expected parity value. \n To clear PF, write a logic one to the PF

field.name: FE
field.description: Framing Error Flag\n FE is set whenever the next character to be read from LPUART_DATA was received with logic 0 detected where a stop bit was expected. \n To clear NF, write logic one to the NF

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No framing error detected. This does not guarantee the framing is correct

field.name: NF
field.description: Noise Flag\n The advanced sampling technique used in the receiver takes three samples in each of the received bits. If any of these samples disagrees with the rest of the samples within any bit time in the frame then noise is detected for that character. NF is set whenever the next character to be read from DATA was received with noise detected within the character. \n To clear NF, write logic one to the NF

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Noise detected in the received character in DATA

field.name: OR
field.description: Receiver Overrun Flag\n OR is set when software fails to prevent the receive data register from overflowing with data. The OR bit is set immediately after the stop bit has been completely received for the dataword that overflows the buffer and all the other error flags (FE, NF, and PF) are prevented from setting. The data in the shift register is lost, but the data already in the LPUART data registers is not affected. If LBKDE is enabled and a LIN Break is detected, the OR field asserts if LBKDIF is not cleared before the next data character is received. While the OR flag is set, no additional data is stored in the data buffer even if sufficient room exists. \n To clear OR, write logic 1 to the OR flag

field.name: IDLE
field.description: Idle Line Flag\n IDLE is set when the LPUART receive line becomes idle for a full character time after a period of activity. When ILT is cleared, the receiver starts counting idle bit times after the start bit.\n To clear IDLE, write logic 1 to the IDLE flag

field.name: RDRF
field.description: Receive Data Register Full Flag\n RDRF is set when the receive buffer (LPUART_DATA) is full. \n To clear RDRF, read the LPUART_DATA register

field.name: TC
field.description: Transmission Complete Flag\n TC is cleared when there is a transmission in progress or when a preamble or break character is loaded. TC is set when the transmit buffer is empty and no data, preamble, or break character is being transmitted

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break)

field.name: TDRE
field.description: Transmit Data Register Empty Flag\n TDRE will set when the transmit data register (LPUART_DATA) is empty. To clear TDRE, write to the LPUART data register (LPUART_DATA)

field.name: RAF
field.description: Receiver Active Flag\n RAF is set when the receiver detects the beginning of a valid start bit, and RAF is cleared automatically when the receiver detects an idle line

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver idle waiting for a start bit

field.name: LBKDE
field.description: LIN Break Detection Enable\n LBKDE selects a longer break character detection length. While LBKDE is set, receive data is not stored in the receive data buffer

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Break character is detected at length 10 bit times (if M=0, SBNS=0) or 11 (if M=1, SBNS=0 or M=0, SBNS=1) or\n 12 (if M=1, SBNS=1 or M10=1, SNBS=0) or 13 (if M10=1, SNBS=1)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Break character is detected at length of 11 bit times (if M=0, SBNS=0) or 12 (if M=1, SBNS=0 or M=0, SBNS=1) or\n 14 (if M=1, SBNS=1 or M10=1, SNBS=0) or 15 (if M10=1, SNBS=1)

field.name: BRK13
field.description: Break Character Generation Length\n BRK13 selects a longer transmitted break character length. Detection of a framing error is not affected by the state of this bit. This bit should only be changed when the transmitter is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 10 bit times (if M=0, SBNS=0) or 11 (if M=1, SBNS=0 or M=0, SBNS=1) or \n 12 (if M=1, SBNS=1 or M10=1, SNBS=0) or 13 (if M10=1, SNBS=1)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 13 bit times (if M=0, SBNS=0) or 14 (if M=1, SBNS=0 or M=0, SBNS=1) or \n 15 (if M=1, SBNS=1 or M10=1, SNBS=0) or 16 (if M10=1, SNBS=1)

field.name: RWUID
field.description: Receive Wake Up Idle Detect For RWU on idle character, RWUID controls whether the idle character that wakes up the receiver sets the IDLE bit. For address match wakeup, RWUID controls if the IDLE bit is set when the address does not match. This bit should only be changed when the receiver is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit does not get set upon detection of an idle character.\n During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does not get set when an address does not match

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit gets set upon detection of an idle character.\n During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does get set when an address does not match

field.name: RXINV
field.description: Receive Data Inversion\n Setting this bit reverses the polarity of the received data input

field.name: MSBF
field.description: MSB First\n Setting this bit reverses the order of the bits that are transmitted and received on the wire. This bit does not affect the polarity of the bits, the location of the parity bit or the location of the start or stop bits. This bit should only be changed when the transmitter and receiver are both disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: LSB (bit0) is the first data bit that is transmitted or received

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: MSB (bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first data bit that is transmitted or received

field.name: RXEDGIF
field.description: LPUART_RX Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag RXEDGIF is set when an active edge, falling if RXINV = 0, rising if RXINV=1, on the LPUART_RX pin occurs. RXEDGIF is cleared by writing a 1 to it

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No active edge on the receive pin has occurred

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: An active edge on the receive pin has occurred

field.name: LBKDIF
field.description: LIN Break Detect Interrupt Flag\n LBKDIF is set when the LIN break detect circuitry is enabled and a LIN break character is detected. LBKDIF is cleared by writing a 1 to it

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No LIN break character has been detected

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: LIN break character has been detected

field.name: PT
field.description: Parity Type\n Provided parity is enabled (PE = 1), this bit selects even or odd parity. Odd parity means the total number of 1s in the data character, including the parity bit, is odd. Even parity means the total number of 1s in the data character, including the parity bit, is even

field.name: PE
field.description: Parity Enable\n Enables hardware parity generation and checking. When parity is enabled, the bit immediately before the stop bit is treated as the parity bit

field.name: ILT
field.description: Idle Line Type Select\n Determines when the receiver starts counting logic 1s as idle character bits. The count begins either after a valid start bit or after the stop bit. If the count begins after the start bit, then a string of logic 1s preceding the stop bit can cause false recognition of an idle character. Beginning the count after the stop bit avoids false idle character recognition, but requires properly synchronized transmissions

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Idle character bit count starts after start bit

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Idle character bit count starts after stop bit

field.name: WAKE
field.description:
Receiver Wakeup Method Select
 Determines which condition wakes the LPUART when RWU=1:
 - Address mark in the most significant bit position of a received data character, or
 - An idle condition on the receive pin input signal

field.name: M
field.description: 9-Bit or 8-Bit Mode Select

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver and transmitter use 9-bit data characters start + 8 data bits + 9th data bit + stop

field.name: RSRC
field.description: Receiver Source Select\n This field has no meaning or effect unless the LOOPS field is set. When LOOPS is set, the RSRC field determines the source for the receiver shift register input

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Internal loop back mode and the UART does not use the RxD pins

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Single-wire UART mode where the TxD pin is connected to the transmitter output and receiver input

field.name: DOZEEN
field.description: Stops in Wait Mode

field.name: LOOPS
field.description: Loop Mode Select\n When set, the Rx pin is disconnected from the LPUART and the transmitter output is internally connected to the receiver input. \n The transmitter and the receiver must be enabled to use the loop function

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal operation - RxD and TxD use separate pins

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Loop mode where transmitter output is internally connected to receiver input. The receiver input is determined by the RSRC bit

field.name: MA2IE
field.description: Match 2 Interrupt Enable

field.name: MA1IE
field.description: Match 1 Interrupt Enable

field.name: SBK
field.description: Send Break\n Writing a 1 and then a 0 to SBK queues a break character in the transmit data stream

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Queue break character(s) to be sent

field.name: RWU
field.description: Receiver Wakeup Control\n This field can be set to place the LPUART receiver in a standby state. RWU automatically clears when an RWU event occurs, that is, an IDLE event when CTRL[WAKE] is clear or an address match when CTRL[WAKE] is set with STAT[RWUID] is clear

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: LPUART receiver in standby waiting for wakeup condition

field.name: RE
field.description: Receiver Enable\n Enables the LPUART receiver. When RE is written to 0, this register bit will read as 1 until the receiver finishes receiving the current character (if any)

field.name: TE
field.description: Transmitter Enable\n Enables the LPUART transmitter. TE can also be used to queue an idle preamble by clearing and then setting TE. When TE is cleared, this register bit will read as 1 until the transmitter has completed the current character and the LPUART_TX pin is tristated

field.name: ILIE
field.description: Idle Line Interrupt Enable\n ILIE enables the idle line flag, STAT[IDLE], to generate interrupt requests

field.name: RIE
field.description: Receiver Interrupt Enable for RDRF

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupts from RDRF disabled; use polling

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupt requested when RDRF flag is 1

field.name: TCIE
field.description: Transmission Complete Interrupt Enable\n TCIE enables the transmission complete flag, TC, to generate interrupt requests

field.name: TIE
field.description: Transmit Interrupt Enable for TDRE\n Enables STAT[TDRE] to generate interrupt requests

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupts from TDRE disabled; use polling

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TDRE flag is 1

field.name: PEIE
field.description: Parity Error Interrupt Enable\n This bit enables the parity error flag (PF) to generate hardware interrupt requests

field.name: FEIE
field.description: Framing Error Interrupt Enable\n This bit enables the framing error flag (FE) to generate hardware interrupt requests

field.name: NEIE
field.description: Noise Error Interrupt Enable\n This bit enables the noise flag (NF) to generate hardware interrupt requests

field.name: ORIE
field.description: Overrun Error Interrupt Enable\n This bit enables the overrun flag (OR) to generate hardware interrupt requests

field.name: TXINV
field.description: Transmit Data Inversion\n Setting this bit reverses the polarity of the transmitted data output

field.name: TXDIR
field.description: Transmitter Pin Data Direction in Single-Wire mode\n When the LPUART is configured for single-wire half-duplex operation (LOOPS = RSRC = 1), this bit determines the direction of data at the LPUART_TX pin. When clearing TXDIR, the transmitter will finish receiving the current character (if any) before the receiver starts receiving data from the LPUART_TX pin

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: TxD pin is an input in single-wire mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: TxD pin is an output in single-wire mode

field.name: R9T8
field.description: Receive Bit 9 / Transmit Bit 8

field.name: R8T9
field.description: Receive Bit 8 / Transmit Bit 9

register.name: DATA
register.description: Data Register\n Reads return the contents of the read-only receive data buffer and writes go to the write-only transmit data buffer. Reads and writes of this register are also involved in the automatic flag clearing mechanisms for the UART status flags

field.name: RT
field.description: Read receive data buffer or write transmit data buffer

field.name: IDLINE
field.description: Idle Line\n Indicates the receiver line was idle before receiving the character in DATA[9:0]. Unlike the IDLE flag, this bit can set for the first character received when the receiver is first enabled

field.name: RXEMPT
field.description: Receive Buffer Empty\n Asserts when there is no data in the receive buffer. This field does not take into account data that is in the receive shift register

field.name: FRETSC
field.description: Frame Error / Transmit Special Character\n For reads, indicates the current received dataword contained in DATA[R9:R0] was received with a frame error. For writes, indicates a break or idle character is to be transmitted instead of the contents in DATA[T9:T0]. T9 is used to indicate a break character when 0 and a idle character when 1, he contents of DATA[T8:T0] should be zero

field.name: PARITYE
field.description: Parity Error\n The current received dataword contained in DATA[R9:R0] was received with a parity error

field.name: NOISY
field.description: Noise Error\n The current received dataword contained in DATA[R9:R0] was received with noise

register.name: MATCH
register.description:
Match Address Register
 The MA1 and MA2 registers are compared to input data addresses when the most significant bit is set and the associated BAUD[MAEN] bit is set. 
 If a match occurs, the following data is transferred to the data register. 
 If a match fails, the following data is discarded. 
 Software should only write a MA register when the associated BAUD[MAEN] bit is clear

field.name: MA1
field.description: Match Address 1

field.name: MA2
field.description: Match Address 2

register.name: MODIR
register.description: MODEM register\n The MODEM register controls options for setting the modem configuration
